body.name: Coleman Triton 2-Burner Propane Camping Stove, Portable Camping Grill/Stove with Adjustable Burners, Wind Guards, Heavy-Duty Latch & Handle, 22,000 Total BTUs of Power for Camping, Tailgating, BBQ
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 3 hrs 51 mins
features: PORTABLE: Easy addition to the campsite, picnic, roadside, and more
TWO WIND GUARDS: Help shield and protect burners from wind
HEAVY-DUTY LATCH: Easy to open and keeps the stove closed when not in use
EASY TO CLEAN: Durable, chrome-plated grate is removable for easy cleanup
IMPROVED KNOB ROTATION: For precise temperature and simmering control of two independently adjustable burners
POWERFUL STOVE: 22,000 total BTUs of cooking power
BURN TIME: Up to 1 hour on high on one 16 oz. propane cylinder (sold separately)

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Where We Started It all began when we created the first portable, gas-powered lantern that illuminated the first evening football game west of the Mississippi. In WWII, our camping stoves transformed the way soldiers ate in the field. We continued to revolutionize the outdoors with our cooler manufacturing in the 1950s, and in the decades that followed we added tents, sleeping bags, lighting, and more.

Where We Are Today After 120 years, Coleman gear is everywhere you are: on the trail, by the lake, at a tailgate, or in the middle of a music festival. We're always around a place where there are friends, coolers, and campfires. So, grab a tent, fire up a grill, and pull up a chair. The Outside Is Calling. Answer it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very happy with it
reviews.reviewText: "Light weight" is relative. For a backpacker this is not light at all. For tent or car camping, I think this is really light, but not flimsy. I've only used it on 2 camping trips so far, so I can't speak for it's longevity, but I'm impressed with its function so far. I haven't tried to cook anything that was super delicate and needed an ultra-low setting, but I've done fluffy scrambled eggs which need a lower temp, and they turned out great (and fluffy)! I specifically did not want the version of this stove with the piezo lighter. I find that they typically go bad at some point and why spend the extra $20? I use a rechargeable arc lighter that never requires that I get too close to the flame, and I recharge it once in a while. I just prefer that.This stove is super easy to clean. The rack lifts out easily so that I can wipe down the interior and soak the rack if necessary. I don't love the black metal casing because I live in the desert southwest and the sun is intense and heats the black metal up. I bought a propane hose converter from the 1lb connector to my 20 lb tank, and that has worked flawlessly. I have also used it with a 1 lb tank with no problems either. I just prefer not to use the disposable 1 pounders. A 5 lb tank is in my future--best of both worlds, but I digress. This stove boils water pretty quickly (in my 6-cup percolator). Perhaps not as fast as JetBoils or other stoves of that nature, but for an 11,000btu burner (11,000 per burner) it's quick (perhaps about 3-ish minutes). I've had a Camp Chef Explorer where each burner was 22,000 btu and that is major overkill for me at this stage of my camping. That said, I didn't want anything with less than 10,000btu. The stove has a built-in hand grip when it's closed up, so nothing rattling around. As for the propane connector, I made a small bag out the leg of an old pair of jeans that I'd cut off, and it prevents the connector from clanking around inside the stove while transporting it. I would have no hesitation to recommend this stove to anyone if they're looking for a two-burner camp stove that isn't as...hefty as my Camp Chef was.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Simple and functional
reviews.reviewText: Gets the job done quick and easy. Great price at the time of purchase. Very good all around car camping stove.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good basic stove
reviews.reviewText: I could have used more instructions for initial assembly. A friend a couple campsites over got that solved for me.I am perfectly happy to have this less expensive stove and light it manually--lighters and matches are cheap. Fewer things to break. The burner control knobs seemed to work well--an issue reported in a prior version of this stove. I did not have any trouble reducing the flame as desired.This is much smaller, lighter, and easier to use than the Coleman stove my grandmother cooked on all her camping days. May it last as long!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great product even beyond camping use.
reviews.reviewText: This product provides plenty of power and space to heat up cookware. The portability for something this size is great, especially with the built in case carrier. Sometimes, my family uses this to deep fry foods outdoors rather than using our indoor kitchen stove. I also purchased a hose adapter to be able to connect a large propane gas tank to the Coleman stove for longer use versus having to change out the smaller Green Coleman propane tanks more frequently.The only downside is that this camp stove does not come with a built-in igniter. Although there are some stoves that have really cheap igniters that end up not working somehow.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Don't forget the matches!
reviews.reviewText: Bought this for weekend camping trips and emergency use if the power goes out. Tried it out this weekend to cook some pancakes and heat up water for coffee. I don't know why anyone would complain about the build quality. Yes it's not made from the thickest gauge metal, it's thin to make it lighter and it does seem to have a high-quality paint on it. With the adjustable wind guards, I was able to fit a 12" skillet over a burner. I wouldn't recommend trying to cook pancakes this way, as the thin GSI skillet wouldn't heat very evenly and the pancakes were always have done on one side. I told everyone they were my special Yin-Yang Panckes... very hard to make! I'll purchase the available griddle ( Coleman Camp Stove 2 Burner Griddle ) for the next breakfast meal. It's probably much thicker and better and distributing the heat, plus you could cook bacon and pancakes at the same time. Grate is removable for quick and easy clean up. Propane bottle attaches very quickly and easily. The only thing missing is the instastart ignitor button. I think you have to spend $20 more to get the model with the ignitor ( Coleman 2000012034 InstaStart Triton Stove . Just don't forget to bring the matches or long lighter and be careful when lighting.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just buy it!!
reviews.reviewText: Just buy it!! I spent a ton of time studying what is the best way to buy a stove, it's just beautiful, compact, portable, with wind protection, a good proven brand, and I've seen the same one with piezo ignition, I don't need to overpay for it even $ 20, since in such portable broadcasting you need ease of operation, I'll take matches it's not difficult, but all these extra functions and buttons are not reliable, they can sink and break with frequent movement and mobility. The price is just great for such a stove, we used a propane tank, the food was cooked in 15 minutes, I brewed coffee fried kratoshka onion eggs and bacon, it is very powerful and wind protection is really convenient, you don't need to invent anything else, just light the gas and cook. By the way, I took the largest diameter of my frying pan 15 in and it fit perfectly and there was also a coffee kettle on the second burner next to it. I highly recommend this oven!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Stood up to high winds on recent camping trip. Works great, easy to use, easy to set up and packs up slim. Does not have push to start lighter, needs external light. Rugged, scratch resistant case. 10 inch cast iron skillet fit perfect, 12 inch would fit but may be a little snug if using both burners. Overall, would recommend.

We used this for 3 days camping and it worked perfectly! So easy to light the stove, just turn the dial, the propane comes through and you can easily light your burners. The top grill comes off so it is easy to clean up any spills. Pack up very compact. We are so glad we bought this to go camping. Very good purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Maintenance free and cleaning a breeze!
reviews.reviewText: I was looking for stove that has a easy to clean flat lid/deck below the burners instead of abyss/cavity which makes cleaning a nightmare, imagine the grime and cooking residue, yucks! This of the many Coleman with that feature.

Love this! We used it for camping this summer and it heats up super quickly! We got the base model so have to use a lighter to light it and it works perfectly. I also LOVE that it all folds together and that the hose for the propane tank comes off and fits inside for storage. It is so sleek and small, and I love how easy it is to clean!!!
